required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Clinical Efficacy of Y-STRUT® Medical Device Implanted for Contralateral Percutaneous Internal Fixation of Proximal Femur, in Patient With a Low Energy Per Trochanteric Fracture on the First Side
clinical_study.official_title: National, Multicentre, Prospective, Observational Study, to Evaluate the Clinical Efficacy of Y-STRUT® Medical Device Implanted for Contralateral Percutaneous Internal Fixation of Proximal Femur, in Patient With a Low Energy Per Trochanteric Fracture on the First Side

brief_summary.textblock:
HIP50 is a national, multicentre, prospective, observational study, in patients presenting a first low energy per trochanteric hip fracture on one side and treated with Y-STRUT® device implanted on the contralateral proximal femur as percutaneous internal fixation to prevent contralateral hip fracture in case of osteoporosis.
The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the clinical efficacy of the studied medical device by measuring the frequency of patient with a fracture at the implantation site within 1 year after implantation.
A total of 50 patients from France will be enrolled (until December 2020) and followed up to 24 months.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Suspension of the study upon the decision of the notified body

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of post-operative fracture [Clinical efficacy of the device]
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of Y-STRUT® implanted patients with a fracture at the implantation site

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of post-operative fracture [Clinical efficacy of the device]
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of Y-STRUT® implanted patients with a fracture at the implantation site

secondary_outcome.measure: Recording of concomitants treatments [safety and feasibility of the device]
secondary_outcome.description: Recording of all concomitants treatments: analgesic for pain, anti-osteoporotic treatment and other treatments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain [safety and feasibility of the device]
secondary_outcome.description: Self-evaluation of hip pain using VAS (Visual Analogue Scale), going from 0 (no pain) to 10 (maximum).

secondary_outcome.measure: Walking conditions [safety and feasibility of the device]
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of resumption of weight-bearing (yes/no, aid)

secondary_outcome.measure: Recording of adverse events and device effects [safety and feasibility of the device]
secondary_outcome.description: Recording of the medical device vigilance: all serious adverse events, all adverse events linked to the device or the operative technique, and any other important event reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgical procedure duration [learning curve of the procedure]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period (24 months from the first included patient)
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring mean/median intervention duration of each procedure. Then, all the durations of successive procedures will be compared among all the investigators.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospitalisation duration [learning curve of the procedure]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period (24 months from the first included patient)]
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring mean/median hospitalisation duration. Then, all the durations of successive hospitalisations will be compared among all the investigators.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of complications [learning curve of the procedure]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period (24 months from the first included patient)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing types and frequencies of procedures complications (per-op and post-op). Then, all the rate of complications will be compared among all the investigators.

intervention.description: The studied medical device consists of two components implanted in the proximal femur, combined with bone cement.

study_pop.textblock: Patients presenting a first low energy per trochanteric hip fracture on one side and treated with Y-STRUT® device implanted on the contralateral proximal femur as percutaneous internal fixation.

facility.name: Nouvelle Clinique de Tours Plus St Gatien
